abstract: Supreme Court Judge Catherine Bruce of British Columbia overturns conviction of John Stuart Nuttall and Amanda Marie Korody, couple found guilty of terrorism in 2013, saying they were entrapped by Royal Canadian Mounted Police; Nuttall and Korody were convicted after placing what they believed to be pressure-cooker bombs outside British Columbia's legislature.
lead_paragraph: British Columbia court finds that the Royal Canadian Mounted Police manipulated a couple into planting what they thought were pressure-cooker bombs.

headline.main: Canada Judge Rules That Police Entrapped Couple in Bomb Plot
headline.print_headline: Canada Judge Rules That Police Entrapped Couple in Bomb Plot

snippet: British Columbia court finds that the Royal Canadian Mounted Police manipulated a couple into planting what they thought were pressure-cooker bombs....
